alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:45AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Yellowstone National Park through 1215 PM MDT... At 1144 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harlequin Lake, or 9 miles east of West Yellowstone, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gibbons Falls and Twin Lakes around 1155 AM MDT. Virginia Cascade and Norris Junction around 1200 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Grebe Lake, Canyon, Lower Falls, Cascade Lake, Dunraven Pass, and Mount Washburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
